com.acrolinx.javasdk.api.extraction

Interface Document

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BlockDocument<PositionInDocument>, Document.NullDocument
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDocument, BlockDocumentImpl, StreamDocument, StringDocument

    public interface Document
    A ServerEndpoint can check documents via the CheckAdapter. If you want to check text, it must be wrapped in a class implementing the Document interface assigned to a CheckInformation and then call CheckAdapter.check(com.acrolinx.javasdk.api.checksettings.CheckSettings, CheckInformation, com.acrolinx.javasdk.api.checksettings.DocumentCheckSettings) . Some known implementations delivered with the Acrolinx Java SDK are StringDocument, FileDocument, and StreamDocument.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Document.NullDocument
      The class Document.NullDocument is a null object for Document.

    • Field Detail

      • NULL

        static final Document NULL
        see: Document.NullDocument

    • Method Detail

      • getText

        String getText()
        Returns:
        the extracted text of the document.

        Note: This method will be called more than once by the Acrolinx Java SDK. It is expected that the result is always same. Maybe your implementation has to cache the result for performance reasons.

      • getContextInformation

        Set<ContextInformation> getContextInformation()
        Returns:
        the set of ContextInformations of the document

      • getSoftExclusionContextInformation

        Set<ContextInformation> getSoftExclusionContextInformation()
        Returns:
        the set of ContextInformations of the document to be excluded for checking

      • getOriginalOffset

        int getOriginalOffset(int offsetInExtractedText)
        This method should be called by integration to map flag offset back to original document offsets.
        Returns:
        The offset in original document.
        Note: in BlockDocuments you should call DocumentPartMapping.getOriginalDocumentParts(com.acrolinx.javasdk.api.extraction.documents.block.Range) instead.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - in case the given offsetInExtractedText is outside the document.

      • getAuthor

        Author getAuthor()
        Gets the Author of the Document. See: Author
        Returns:
        the Author of the Document

      • getFilename

        FileName getFilename()
        Gets the FileName of the Document.
        Returns:
        the FileName of the Document

      • getFileFormat

        FileFormat getFileFormat()
        Gets the FileFormat of the Document.
        Returns:
        the FileFormat of the Document.

      • isSoftSkipping

        boolean isSoftSkipping()
